meanings.definition: A condition in which an individual has difficulty seeing in dim light or at night.
meanings.sent1: My friend's nyctalopia makes it hard for him to see at night.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed her with nyctalopia after she struggled to see in the dark.
meanings.sent3: When the owl complained about its nyctalopia, the other animals chuckled.
meanings.sent4: His nyctalopia was like wearing sunglasses in a dark room, everything seemed dim.
meanings.sent5: The nyctalopia of the cave was so intense, I could barely make out my hand in front of my face.

meanings.definition: The inability to see clearly in low light conditions.
meanings.sent1: The nyctalopia of the basement made it hard to find the light switch.
meanings.sent2: She always carries a flashlight due to her nyctalopia in dark alleys.
meanings.sent3: The cat blamed its nyctalopia for mistaking a sock for a mouse.
meanings.sent4: His nyctalopia felt like trying to read a book with sunglasses on.
meanings.sent5: The nyctalopia of the forest at night was so severe, she couldn't see the path ahead.
